message_1: What is the activation energy of the reaction between hydrogen gas and iodine gas to form hydrogen iodide, given that the rate constant at 25°C is 1.52 × 10^-3 L^2mol^-2s^-1 and the activation energy of the reaction is 186.3 kJ/mol?
message_2: The activation energy of the reaction between hydrogen gas and iodine gas to form hydrogen iodide is already given in the problem statement. It is 186.3 kJ/mol.
